header.title: Best Freshwater Fishing Lake In The World
content: The best freshwater fishing charter in Panama. Come and discover the biggest artificial lake of the world, with some of the best game fish.

aboutUs.title: Gatun sport fishing Slogan
content: 4.8 Stars rating on Fishing Booker and other charter websites, for more than 10 years we have gave our guests the best atention, gear and boats of all Gatun lake. Our goal is to give you the best fishing experience of your live.

GSF team is ready to make that dream happen. We are located at the heart of the Panama Canal, Going out from Gamboa Rainforest Hotel with security 24/7 and private parking, restaurants, pool and so much more!

The lake is renowned for its excellent fishing opportunities, and anglers come from all over the world to experience its unique fishing environment. The lake is home to many species of fish, including peacock bass, tarpon, snook, catfish, and more. The peacock bass is the most sought-after fish in the lake, and it's not hard to see why. These fish are aggressive and put up a good fight, making them a popular target for anglers.

Fishing at the Gatun Lake can be done in many ways, and there are various fishing techniques that anglers can use. Some anglers prefer to use lures, while others prefer live bait. The lake's fishing environment is diverse, and anglers can fish in the lake's shallow waters, deep waters, or even near the lake's many islands.

This will be an unforgettable experience that every angler should have. The lake's unique fishing environment, diverse fish species, and peaceful atmosphere make it an ideal spot for fishing enthusiasts. Whether you are an experienced angler or a beginner, fishing at the Gatun Lake is an experience that you will never forget.

fish.title: Target Species
description: Fishing at the Gatun Lake in Panama is an incredible experience that every angler should have on their bucket list. Gatun Lake is a man-made lake located in the Panama Canal Zone and is one of the largest lakes in the world. It spans over 166 square miles and is home to a diverse range of fish species.

fishes.label: Peacock bass
description: Peacock bass is a popular game fish that is found in many countries, including Panama. Peacock bass is a species of cichlid fish that are known for their colorful appearance and aggressive nature. They are a popular target for anglers who enjoy a challenging fight.

Peacock bass are known for their hard-hitting strikes and their ability to put up a strong fight when hooked. They are often caught using lures, such as topwater plugs, jigs, and spinnerbaits. Anglers who target peacock bass in Panama often use heavy tackle to handle the fish's powerful runs and jumps.

fishes.label: Tarpon
description: The tarpon or tarpon (Megalops atlanticus species) is an elopiform osteichthyan fish of the megalopid family.It is a large fish, between two and two.5 m and around one hundred and fifty to one hundred sixty-one kg in weight, with a fusiform body similar to a herring, completely covered with large and thick scales, bluish-green on the surface. top and silver on its sides. The dorsal fin begins in the middle of the reverse and at the last ray, in the same way as the anal fin, it extends to form a filament. The pectoral fins are low and the pelvic fins are abdominal.Royal tarpon inhabit the riparian areas of the Atlantic, Florida, and in Africa at tropical latitudes. They also inhabit estuaries and even rivers and lakes. They gather in schools to chase, sometimes even freshwater, the fish on which they feed. Its meat is not particularly pleasant, but its important size makes it a desirable prey for sport fishing.

fishes.label: Snook
description: Snook fish, also known as robalo, is a popular game fish here in Panama. They are known for their aggressive strikes and acrobatic jumps, making them a favorite target for many anglers.

Snook fish are a highly sought-after game fish among anglers due to their hard-fighting nature and excellent eating quality. They can be found in a variety of habitats, including mangrove-lined creeks, estuaries, and nearshore waters. Snook fish are also known to migrate between freshwater and saltwater environments, making them a challenging and exciting target for anglers of all skill levels.

fishes.label: Jack
description: They are known for their aggressive feeding habits and are a popular target for anglers who enjoy a challenging fight.

Jack Crevalle fish are a sight to behold. These fish have a distinctive appearance, with a dark olive-green or blue back, silver sides, and a yellow or white belly. They have a forked tail and a prominent black spot on their gill cover. Jack Crevalle fish can grow up to 40 inches in length and weigh up to 60 pounds, making them a formidable opponent for any angler.

These fish are known for their strength and speed, and they put up a fierce fight when hooked. They are often caught using live bait, lures, or by fly fishing. Anglers who target Jack Crevalle fish often use heavy tackle and braided line to handle the fish's explosive runs and powerful jumps.

Jack Crevalle fish are found in a variety of habitats, including nearshore waters, estuaries, and inlets. They are opportunistic feeders and will eat a variety of prey, including small fish, shrimp, and crabs. Anglers often target these fish by casting lures near structure such as jetties, rocks, or bridge pilings, where Jack Crevalle fish are known to gather.

fishes.label: Wildlife
description: The Gamboa Rainforest is a lush, tropical paradise located in Panama, Central America. The rainforest is situated on the banks of the Chagres River and is surrounded by the Soberania National Park, one of the most biodiverse areas in the world. The Gamboa Rainforest is a haven for wildlife, with over 500 species of birds, 105 species of mammals, and 79 species of reptiles and amphibians.

Another popular activity in the Gamboa Rainforest is river tours. Visitors can take a boat tour down the Chagres River and see the rainforest from a different perspective. The river is home to many animals, including crocodiles, turtles, and monkeys, and visitors can also spot many bird species along the riverbanks.

The rainforest is a popular destination for nature lovers, adventure seekers, and eco-tourists. Visitors can explore the rainforest on foot, by boat, or by zip line, and there are many activities to choose from. One of the most popular activities is bird watching, as the rainforest is home to many rare and exotic bird species, including toucans, macaws, and parrots. Visitors can also go on guided hikes to explore the rainforest's many trails and discover the diverse flora and fauna that call the rainforest home.
